@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
content {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem?null} The content widget of the scroll
container.
@param.description:
The content widget of the scroll
container.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Sets the content of the scroll container. Scroll containers
may only have one child, so it always replaces the current
child with the given one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} Widget to insert
@param.description: Widget to insert

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the content of the scroll area.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} Widget to remove
@param.description: Widget to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the content of the scroll container.

Scroll containers may only have one child. This
method returns an array containing the child or an empty array.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object[]} The child array

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The content padding target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Creates a new scrollbar. This can either be a styled qooxdoo scrollbar
or a native browser scrollbar.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: orientation {String?"horizontal"} The initial scroll bar orientation
@param.description: The initial scroll bar orientation

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.scroll.IScrollBar} The scrollbar instance

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the pointerdown event which simply stops the momentum scrolling.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Pointer} pointerdown event
@param.description: pointerdown event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Roll event handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Roll} Roll event
@param.description: Roll event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds the first scrollable parent (in the parent chain).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} The widget to start from.
@param.description: The widget to start from.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} A scrollable widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is scrollable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to check.
@param.description: The widget to check.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the widget is scrollable.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the bounds of the given scrollable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollable {qx.ui.core.Widget} Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.
@param.description: Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with all four bounds (e.g. {"left":0, "top":20, "right":0, "bottom":80}).
@return.desc: A map with all four bounds (e.g. {"left":0, "top":20, "right":0, "bottom":80}).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the edge type or null if the pointer isn't within one of the thresholds.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: diff {Map} Difference map with all for edgeTypes.
@param.description: Difference map with all for edgeTypes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: thresholdX {Number} x-axis threshold.
@param.description: x-axis threshold.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: thresholdY {Number} y-axis threshold.
@param.description: y-axis threshold.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the axis ('x' or 'y') by the edge type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: edgeType {String} One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').
@param.description: One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If edgeType is not one of the distinct four ones.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} Returns 'y' or 'x'.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the threshold amount by edge type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: edgeType {String} One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').
@param.description: One of the four edgeTypes ('left', 'right', 'top', 'bottom').

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The threshold of the x or y axis.
@return.desc: The threshold of the x or y axis.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the scrollbar is visible.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollable {qx.ui.core.Widget} Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.
@param.description: Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} Can be 'y' or 'x'.
@param.description: Can be 'y' or 'x'.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the scrollbar is visible.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the scrollbar is exceeding it's maximum position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollbar {qx.ui.core.scroll.IScrollBar} Scrollbar to check.
@param.description: Scrollbar to check.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} Can be 'y' or 'x'.
@param.description: Can be 'y' or 'x'.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: amount {Number} Amount to scroll which may be negative.
@param.description: Amount to scroll which may be negative.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the amount will exceed the scrollbar max position.
@return.desc: Whether the amount will exceed the scrollbar max position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Calculates the threshold exceedance (which may be negative).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: diff {Number} Difference value of one edgeType.
@param.description: Difference value of one edgeType.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: threshold {Number} x-axis or y-axis threshold.
@param.description: x-axis or y-axis threshold.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Calculates the scroll amount (which may be negative).
The amount is influenced by the scrollbar size (bigger = faster)
the exceedanceAmount (bigger = faster) and the slowDownFactor.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollbarSize {Number} Size of the scrollbar.
@param.description: Size of the scrollbar.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: exceedanceAmount {Number} Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).
@param.description: Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} Scroll amount (positive or negative).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls the given scrollable on the given axis for the given amount.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scrollable {qx.ui.core.Widget} Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.
@param.description: Scrollable which has scrollbar child controls.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: axis {String} Can be 'y' or 'x'.
@param.description: Can be 'y' or 'x'.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: exceedanceAmount {Number} Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).
@param.description: Threshold exceedance amount (positive or negative).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the drag event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Drag} The drag event instance.
@param.description: The drag event instance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for the dragend event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Drag} The drag event instance.
@param.description: The drag event instance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a message
Mark the message for translation.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a plural message
Mark the messages for translation.

Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
@param.description: if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a message with translation hint
Mark the messages for translation.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hint {String} hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.
@param.description: hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} message id (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Translate a plural message with translation hint
Mark the messages for translation.

Depending on the third argument the plural or the singular form is chosen.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: hint {String} hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.
@param.description: hint for the translator of the message. Will be included in the .po file.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: singularMessageId {String} message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the singular form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pluralMessageId {String} message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)
@param.description: message id of the plural form (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: count {Integer} if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.
@param.description: if greater than 1 the plural form otherwise the singular form is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {Object} variable number of arguments applied to the format string
@param.description: variable number of arguments applied to the format string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String | LocalizedString} The translated message or localized string
@return.desc: The translated message or localized string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Mark the message for translation but return the original message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: messageId {String} the message ID
@param.description: the message ID

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} messageId

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.desc:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.desc:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The
id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.desc:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a debug message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an info message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a warning message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object
and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.desc:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the
listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.desc:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.desc: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by
{@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.desc: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.desc: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create an event object and dispatch it on this object.
The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you
are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or
sets one property and its value by the first and second argument.
As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a
handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.desc: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be
found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be
found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or
has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property
@param.description: Name of the property

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the property is initialized

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist
